alfredsnippet.snippet:
Freeman J. Dyson, Australian Academy of Science Silver Jubilee Symposium, Vol II, 1980, Is Real Mathematics of any use to physics? p.2

"[Hardy and Eddington] were both great men, and both of them were intellectual snobs whose contempt for the vulgar world of industry and commerce was widely shared among academic people of their generation."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Dyson on Hardy and Eddington
